reviewText: I came online looking to purchase a Rick Steves DVD and I found them all in one package! I recieved these quickly and have since watched over half of them. The quality is great and I found the extras to be somewhat useful. Follow the advice of PACK LIGHT (especially when traveling by train). I could watch these episodes for hours on end! Having been to several of the destinations, I enjoyed seeing places familiar to me, as well as planning future adventures. I have to give this set 5 stars based on quality and quantity of the content. I still can't believe I found these all in one place and for such a great price!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Has there ever been another travel guide more amiable, more informative, more eclectic and just plain likeable than Rick Steves?  This somewhat nerdish but pleasant looking fellow will immediately win the viewer over with his charm, humor and smoothing, layback manner. However what will keep you watching program after program is his consummate knowledge of the sites and people he visits.While each journey is only 30 minutes in length Rick has a unique talent of synthesizing the many facets that make up a people and place. He leaves no stone unturned in his analysis; historical background, spiritual heritage, cultural underpinnings and political legacy are all equally touched upon to give the audience a fuller understanding of the rural and urban landscape.However not not an individual to dwell too much on the past, he provides a delightful tour of the markets, music, restaurants and nightlife. The kind of information would really want to know if you're out for a good time.The production values are also wonderful offering fanstastic visuals that are worth watching even if there where no commentary. Traveling with Rick Steves' is the next best thing to being there.Why not have it all and get this ultimate collection? You know you want it so why put it off any longer? Europe and Rick are waiting to provide the ultimate vacation from the comfort of your own home!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I highly recommend all of the Rick Steves' DVD's.  I use them in my high school Latin classroom to help teach the Italian culture and reinforce the places learned in class.  He has shows on all popular and less traveled places throughout Europe.  All world language and English teachers will love this shows.  Each one is 25 minutes so it works well as a "sponge" activity in addition to placing it within a unit.  The one on Naples and Pompeii is excellent at the end of my Vesuvius culture unit.  It's a MUST for your HS classroom.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Rick Steves' travel videos are wonderful.  They show you what to expect.  They show you how to get around.  They make you want to go everywhere in Europe.  And they are a wonderful way to remember your own visits.
summary: The perfect gift to fire up a friend for European travel.
Title: N/A

reviewText: You owe it to yourself to purchase Rick Steve's collection of his wonderful series which ran for seven years on PBS.  Steves not only takes you to the most popular destinations, but shares those locales that are off the beaten path but so rewarding; for example, Cinque Terre, Italy's "hidden" riviera as well as some popular Eastern European cities like Prague, Krakow, Budapest, Solvenia, Croatia, and even grim Bulgaria--one of former Communist stalwarts behind the Iron Curtain.What makes Steves program valuable is not just the stunning visuals of these European capitals (best seen on a plasma screen), but the helpful travel tips he inserts in virtually every program. Dealing with foreign currency, what not to say or do in a bed & breakfast, how to really mix with the locals, how to pack intelligently, and even eat--and eat well I might add--on a budget are just a few of the tips Steves shares with his audience.  Also there is plenty of information for younger travellers or economically-minded college students who may opt for the hostel instead of a hotel. Even tips for women travelling alone.  Good advice, all around and virtually nothing is overlooked.These shows are nicely presented in a box set divided by region to make it easy to find the disc you want; moreover, the remastering and the production values for these programs are very good. Like any good businessman would, a "bonus disc" includes a bit of self-promotion for "Rick Steves' Tours" that now caters to over 10,000 travellers annually.Not only that, Steves' also sells a line of travelling supplies and equipment--from day bags to toiletry dispensers.  Nevertheless, if you know your local international airport terminal as well as your own kitchen, or just prefer being an "armchair guest" of Steves' travels, everyone will find something to enjoy in this nicely packaged set.
summary: Before you leave for that trip....
Title: N/A

reviewText: watching this show is your best alternative. I saw his show on public TV and became very interested.  I try to get other people interested in it as well because it's fun to watch as well as educational!  The show acts like he is you own personal tour guide and I could sit and watch a marathon of it all day!  He has a friendly, humorous, and passionate personality that goes very well with his very informative show. Unlike other TV personalities, he doesn't come off as too opinionated or a "know it all" who is in your face and over enthusiastic. The show isn't big budgeted and he travels with a small crew so it makes the show feel more personal. Even though he goes to the popular tourist attractions, Rick Steves also shows you little hole-in-the-walls that many people may not be familiar with.  He visits museums, peculiar sites, B&Bs;, and little restaurants which gives viewers a more authentic, unique feel of the place.If you enjoy the Travel Channel, the Food Network, or The History Channel, you will enjoy his show.  Even if you don't ever plan on going to Europe, watching this show is still entertaining and educational.  You end up learning a lot about a country and its history and culture.I only wish he would expand and do shows about other places aside from Europe!
summary: If you never get a chance to visit Europe...
